question: Which country’s unmanned submersible has dived to the world’s deepest ocean point, as of June 2020?
explanation:
The unmanned submersible of China “Haidou-1” has dived to a depth of 10,907 metres at the world’s deepest ocean point.
Haidou-1 has set the record by submerging under the Pacific Ocean surface of the Mariana Trench, the deepest area in the world. During the deep-sea diving operation, it has also collected samples from the deep sea and high-definition images of the geological environment.
